meanings.definition: To twist together, as two or more ropes.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy marling different colored ropes together for my craft projects.
meanings.sent2: The sailors will marling the ropes to secure the sail in place.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to be pirates, marling their jump ropes to make a giant net.
meanings.sent4: She marled her thoughts and emotions together, creating a tangled mess in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The magician marled the ribbons into intricate patterns, mesmerizing the audience.

meanings.definition: A small line made of two strands.
meanings.sent1: The marling was used to secure the boat to the dock.
meanings.sent2: He found a piece of marling on the beach, perfect for his fishing tackle.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the marling, thinking it was a fun toy.
meanings.sent4: The marling of friendship and trust between them was unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: She tied a marling around her wrist as a reminder of her sailing adventure.
